answer_html: In this case, \(\displaystyle \Delta x = 2/n\) and \(\displaystyle k\Delta x = 2k/n\)Therefore, the solution is (v).
answer_latex:
In this case, $\displaystyle \Delta x = 2/n$ and
$\displaystyle k\Delta x = 2k/n$Therefore, the solution is (v).
hints_html:
This is a Riemann sum question.

Use the relationship between the Riemann sum of a function and its integral. This is given by

\(\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\,dx = \lim_{n \to \infty}\sum_{k=1}^{n}f(x_{k})\Delta x\,dx\)

where \(x_{k} = a + k\Delta x\) and \(\Delta x = \frac{b-a}{n}\)
hints_latex: This is a Riemann sum question.

Use the relationship between the Riemann sum of a function and its
integral. This is given by

$\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\,dx = \lim_{n \to \infty}\sum_{k=1}^{n}f(x_{k})\Delta x\,dx$

where $x_{k} = a + k\Delta x$ and $\Delta x = \frac{b-a}{n}$
hints_raw:
This is a Riemann sum question.
Use the relationship between the Riemann sum of a function and its integral. This is given by

<math>
\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\,dx = \lim_{n \to \infty}\sum_{k=1}^{n}f(x_{k})\Delta x\,dx
</math>

where <math> x_{k} = a + k\Delta x </math> and <math>\Delta x = \frac{b-a}{n}</math>
question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
For \(\int_{a}^{b} f(x)\)

The Riemann Sum approximation is

\[\begin{aligned} \sum_{k=1}^{n} f(x_{k})\Delta x = \sum_{k=1}^{n} f(a + k\Delta x) \Delta x\end{aligned}\]

where n represents the total number of rectangles, k enumerates the particular rectangles, and \(\Delta x\) will be equal to \(\frac{b-a}{n}\)

In this case, \(\displaystyle \Delta x = (2-0)/n = 2/n\) and \(\displaystyle k\Delta x = 2k/n\)

Therefore, the solution is (v).
sols_latex:
For $\int_{a}^{b} f(x)$

The Riemann Sum approximation is

\begin{align*}
\sum_{k=1}^{n} f(x_{k})\Delta x = \sum_{k=1}^{n} f(a + k\Delta x) \Delta x
\end{align*}

where \emph{n} represents the total number of rectangles, \emph{k}
enumerates the particular rectangles, and $\Delta x$ will be equal to
$\frac{b-a}{n}$

In this case, $\displaystyle \Delta x = (2-0)/n = 2/n$ and
$\displaystyle k\Delta x = 2k/n$

Therefore, the solution is (v).
sols_raw:
For <math> \int_{a}^{b} f(x)</math>

The Riemann Sum approximation is 

:<math> \sum_{k=1}^{n} f(x_{k})\Delta x = \sum_{k=1}^{n} f(a + k\Delta x) \Delta x</math>  

where ''n'' represents the total number of rectangles, ''k'' enumerates the particular rectangles, and <math> \Delta x </math> will be equal to <math>\frac{b-a}{n} </math>

In this case, <math>\displaystyle \Delta x = (2-0)/n = 2/n</math>  and <math>\displaystyle k\Delta x = 2k/n</math> 

Therefore, the solution is (v).
statement_html:
Multiple Choice Question: Select ONE correct answer (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), or (v).

(c) An approximation to the integral

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^2 \arctan(x)\,dx\end{aligned}\]

using n rectangles would be

(i)   \(\displaystyle {} \sum_{k=0}^2 \arctan(k)\)

(ii)   \(\displaystyle {} \sum_{k=1}^n \arctan\left(\frac{k}{n}\right)\)

(iii)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac2{n} \sum_{k=1}^n \arctan\left(\frac{k}{n}\right)\)

(iv)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac1{n} \sum_{k=0}^2 \arctan\left(\frac{k}{n}\right)\)

(v)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac2{n} \sum_{k=1}^n \arctan\left(\frac{2k}{n}\right)\)
statement_raw:
Multiple Choice Question: Select '''ONE''' correct answer ''(i)'', ''(ii)'', ''(iii)'', ''(iv)'', or ''(v)''.

'''(c)''' An approximation to the integral
:<math>
\int_0^2 \arctan(x)\,dx
</math>
using ''n'' rectangles would be

:''(i)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \sum_{k=0}^2 \arctan(k) </math>

:''(ii)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \sum_{k=1}^n \arctan\left(\frac{k}{n}\right) </math> 

:''(iii)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac2{n} \sum_{k=1}^n \arctan\left(\frac{k}{n}\right) </math> 

:''(iv)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac1{n} \sum_{k=0}^2 \arctan\left(\frac{k}{n}\right) </math> 

:''(v)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac2{n} \sum_{k=1}^n \arctan\left(\frac{2k}{n}\right) </math>
